@github/psotob" date: "2018-01-23" format: revealjs: theme: default footer: "Programa de Formación Científica: Análisis Estadístico 2022 - Sesión 1" transition: convex background-transition: zoom incremental: true slide-number: true preview-links: true parallax-background-image: images/bg-ietsi-slide-first.png parallax-background-size: "1920px 1080px" logo: images/logo-ietsi.png chalkboard: true code-block-background: true code-block-border-left: "#31BAE9" highlight-style: solarized echo: true background-interactive: true --- ::: {.cell} ::: # Introducción a R y RStudio ## ¿Qué es R? {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} - [Preview](https://github.com/psotob) - cARRO ```{.r code-line-numbers="|2"} a <- c(1, 2, 3) a ``` j ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data <- data.frame(x = c(1, 2,3 ), y = c(4, 5, 6)) data ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` x y 1 1 4 2 2 5 3 3 6 ``` ::: ::: ## ¿Qué es RStudio? {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} ```` --- title: "My document" --- Some markdown content. ```{{python}} 1 + 1 ``` Some additional markdown content. ```` ## Recursos y materiales {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} ::: {.cell output-location='slide'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "loess") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Sesion-1_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: # Manejo de datos ## Operaciones matemáticas {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Aritmética :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.nonincremental} - Suma: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} 5 + 4 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 9 ``` ::: ::: - Resta: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} 3 - 8 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] -5 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.nonincremental} - Multiplicación ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} 3 * 8 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 24 ``` ::: ::: - División ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} 3 * 8 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 24 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: :::: ### Resta Content for `Tab B` ::: ## Selección de variables {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} ## Filtrado de datos {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} ## Creación de variables {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} ## {background-color="white" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat" background-iframe="https://www.tidyverse.org/"} ## Otro Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished presentation. To learn more about Quarto presentations see . When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes: - Content authored with markdown - Output from executable code # Análisis descriptivo en R ## Descripción de variables numéricas {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} When you click the **Render** button a presentation will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} 1 + 1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2 ``` ::: ::: ## Casa {background-color="white" background-image="images/bg-ietsi-slide-body.png" background-size="1920px 1080px" background-repeat="repeat"} ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Tab A Content for `Tab A` ### Tab B Content for `Tab B` :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {

      // dispatch for htmlwidgets
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for reveal
    if (window.Reveal) {
      window.Reveal.addEventListener("slidechanged", function(event) {
        fireSlideChanged(event.previousSlide, event.currentSlide);
      });
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
